laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal; did not show any signs of Lhermitte–Duclos disease.
Lesion involving the vertebral body of L-5 with anterior compression of the cauda equina.
Lesions at multiple levels involving vertebral bodies C-6, T-2, T-3, T-4, T-6 and T-7; spinal cord compression noted.
Vascularized lesions of the vertebral body at C-6 and T-2 levels, T5–8 levels, and L-5 level confirmed multiple vertebral hemangiomas.
Revealed abnormal vessels between bone trabeculae, compatible with benign vertebral hemangiomas.
Confirmed good decompression of the spinal cord at T5–7 level.
Lesions were stable, and spinal cord compression at C-6 and L-5 levels had been almost completely eliminated.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Indication of improvement compared to previous levels.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Presence of a nodule 3.5 cm in diameter consistent with follicular carcinoma with minimal invasion.
